name: cloudamqp
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing CloudAMQP resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`cloudamqp` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cloudamqp/terraform-provider-cloudamqp).

apikey.description: Key used to authentication to the CloudAMQP Customer API

baseurl.description: Base URL to CloudAMQP Customer website

description.description: Description name of the rule. e.g. Default.

ip.description: Source ip and netmask for the rule. (e.g. 10.56.72.0/24)

services.description: Pre-defined service ports, see table below

provider.description:
The provider type for the cloudamqp package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

apikey.description: Key used to authentication to the CloudAMQP Customer API

baseurl.description: Base URL to CloudAMQP Customer website

apikey.description: Key used to authentication to the CloudAMQP Customer API

cloudamqp:index/alarm:Alarm.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage alarms to trigger based on a set of conditions. Once triggerd a notification will be sent to the assigned recipients. When creating a new instance, there will also be a set of default alarms (cpu, memory and disk) created. All default alarms uses the default recipient for notifications. By setting `no_default_alarms` to *true* in `cloudamqp.Instance`. This will create the instance without default alarms and avoid the need to import them to get full control. Available for all subscription plans, but `lemur`and `tiger`are limited to fewer alarm types. The limited types supported can be seen in the table below in Alarm Type Reference. ## Alarm Type reference Supported alarm types: `cpu, memory, disk, queue, connection, consumer, netsplit, server_unreachable, notice` Required arguments for all alarms: `instance_id, type, enabled`
Optional argument for all alarms: `tags, queue_regex, vhost_regex` | Name | Type | Shared | Dedicated | Required arguments | | ---- | ---- | ---- | ---- | ---- | | CPU | cpu | - | ✔ | time_threshold, value_threshold | | Memory | memory | - | ✔ | time_threshold, value_threshold | | Disk space | disk | - | ✔ | time_threshold, value_threshold | | Queue | queue | ✔ | ✔  | time_threshold, value_threshold, queue_regex, vhost_regex, message_type | | Connection | connection | ✔ | ✔ | time_threshold, value_threshold | | Consumer | consumer | ✔ | ✔ | time_threshold, value_threshold, queue, vhost | | Netsplit | netsplit | - | ✔ | time_threshold | | Server unreachable | server_unreachable | - | ✔ | time_threshold | | Notice | notice | ✔ | ✔ | | ## Dependency This resource depends on CloudAMQP instance identifier, `cloudamqp_instance.instance.id`. ## Import `cloudamqp_alarm` can be imported using CloudAMQP internal identifier of the alarm together (CSV separated) with the instance identifier. To retrieve the alarm identifier, use [CloudAMQP API](https://docs.cloudamqp.com/cloudamqp_api.html#list-alarms) ```sh $ pulumi import cloudamqp:index/alarm:Alarm alarm ,` ```

enabled.description: Enable or disable the alarm to trigger.

messageType.description: Message type `(total, unacked, ready)` used by queue alarm type.

queueRegex.description: Regex for which queue to check.

recipients.description: Identifier for recipient to be notified. Leave empty to notify all recipients.

timeThreshold.description: The time interval (in seconds) the `value_threshold` should be active before triggering an alarm.

type.description: The alarm type, see valid options below.

valueCalculation.description: Disk value threshold calculation, `fixed, percentage` of disk space remaining.

valueThreshold.description: The value to trigger the alarm for.

vhostRegex.description: Regex for which vhost to check

apikey.description: API key needed to communicate to CloudAMQP's second API. The second API is used to manage alarms, integration and more, full description [CloudAMQP API](https://docs.cloudamqp.com/cloudamqp_api.html).

dedicated.description: Is the instance hosted on a dedicated server

host.description: The external hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.

hostInternal.description: The internal hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.

noDefaultAlarms.description: Set to true to discard creating default alarms when the instance is created. Can be left out, will then use default value = false.

nodes.description: Number of nodes, 1, 3 or 5 depending on plan used. **DEPRECATED. Old subscriptions plan can still change this to scale up or down the instance. New subscriptions plans use the plan to determine number of nodes. In order to change number of nodes the `plan` needs to be updated.**

plan.description: The subscription plan. See available plans

ready.description: Flag describing if the resource is ready

region.description: The region to host the instance in. See Instance regions **Note: Changing region will force the instance to be destroyed and a new created in the new region. All data will be lost and a new name assigned.**

rmqVersion.description: The Rabbit MQ version. Can be left out, will then be set to default value used by CloudAMQP API. **Note: There is not yet any support in the provider to change the RMQ version. Once it's set in the initial creation, it will remain.**

tags.description: One or more tags for the CloudAMQP instance, makes it possible to categories multiple instances in console view. Default there is no tags assigned.

url.description: The AMQP URL (uses the internal hostname if the instance was created with VPC). Has the format: `amqps://{username}:{password}@{hostname}/{vhost}`

vhost.description: The virtual host used by Rabbit MQ.

vpcId.description: The VPC ID. Use this to create your instance in an existing VPC. See available example.

vpcSubnet.description: Creates a dedicated VPC subnet, shouldn't overlap with other VPC subnet, default subnet used 10.56.72.0/24. **NOTE: extra fee will be charged when using VPC, see [CloudAMQP](https://cloudamqp.com) for more information.**

noDefaultAlarms.description: Set to true to discard creating default alarms when the instance is created. Can be left out, will then use default value = false.

nodes.description: Number of nodes, 1, 3 or 5 depending on plan used. **DEPRECATED. Old subscriptions plan can still change this to scale up or down the instance. New subscriptions plans use the plan to determine number of nodes. In order to change number of nodes the `plan` needs to be updated.**

cloudamqp:index/securityFirewall:Securit.description:
## Import

`cloudamqp_security_firewall` can be imported using CloudAMQP instance identifier.

```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudamqp:index/securityFirewall:SecurityFirewall firewall <instance_id>`
```

rules.description: An array of rules, minimum of 1 needs to be configured. Each `rules` block consists of the field documented below.
An array of rules, minimum of 1 needs to be configured. Each `rules` block consists of the field documented below.

rules.description: An array of rules, minimum of 1 needs to be configured. Each `rules` block consists of the field documented below.

peerNetworkUri.description: Network uri of the VPC network to which you will peer with.

cloudamqp:index/vpcPeering:VpcPeering.description:
## Import

`cloudamqp_vpc_peering` can be imported using the CloudAMQP instance identifier.

```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudamqp:index/vpcPeering:VpcPeering <resource_name> <instance_id>`
```

peeringId.description: Peering identifier created by AW peering request.
Peering identifier created by AW peering request.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering VpcPeering resources.

peeringId.description: Peering identifier created by AW peering request.

queue.description: A (durable) queue on your RabbitMQ instance.

retryInterval.description: How often we retry if your endpoint fails (in seconds).

vhost.description: The vhost the queue resides in.

webhookUri.description: A POST request will be made for each message in the queue to this endpoint.

cloudamqp:index/getAccount:getAccount.description:
Use this data source to retrieve basic information about all instances available for an account. Uses the included apikey in provider configuration, to determine which account to read from.

## Attributes reference

All attributes reference are computed

* `id`      - The identifier for this resource. Set to `na` since there is no unique identifier.
* `name`    - The name of the instance.
* `plan`    - The subscription plan used for the instance.
* `region`  - The region were the instanece is located in.
* `tags`    - The tags set for the instance.

## Dependency

This data source depends on apikey set in the provider configuration.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAccount.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getAlarm.

alarmId.description: The alarm identifier. Either use this or `type` to give `cloudamqp.Alarm` necessary information to retrieve the alarm.

type.description: The alarm type. Either use this or `alarm_id` to give `cloudamqp.Alarm` necessary information when retrieve the alarm. Supported alarm types

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAlarm.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCredentials.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCredentials.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

cloudamqp:index/getInstance:getInstance.description:
Use this data source to retrieve information about an already created CloudAMQP instance. In order to retrieve the correct information, the CoudAMQP instance identifier is needed.

## Attributes reference

All attributes reference are computed

* `id`          - The identifier for this resource.
* `name`        - The name of the CloudAMQP instance.
* `plan`        - The subscription plan for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `region`      - The cloud platform and region that host the CloudAMQP instance, `{platform}::{region}`.
* `vpc_id`      - ID of the VPC configured for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `vpc_subnet`  - Dedicated VPC subnet configured for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `nodes`       - Number of nodes in the cluster of the CloudAMQP instance.
* `rmq_version` - The version of installed Rabbit MQ.
* `url`         - (Sensitive) The AMQP URL (uses the internal hostname if the instance was created with VPC), used by clients to connect for pub/sub.
* `apikey`      - (Sensitive) The API key to secondary API handing alarms, integration etc.
* `tags`        - Tags the CloudAMQP instance with categories.
* `host`        - The external hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `host_internal` - The internal hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `vhost`       - The virtual host configured in Rabbit MQ.
